alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued May 02 at 10:22PM EDT until May 03 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches, with isolated higher amounts up to 9 inches above 3500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Pocahontas and Southeast Randolph Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibilities will likely be reduced at times to less than one mile in moderate to heavy snow. West wind between 15 to 25 mph will gust between 30 to 40 mph, causing blowing and drifting snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Additional information can be found at https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and Twitter pages.
